Lack of evidence: The expert's verdict states that there is no evidence to support the claim that Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez made the statement in question. This lack of evidence suggests that the claim is not authentic.
Denial from campaign spokesperson: A spokesperson for Ocasio-Cortez's campaign explicitly denied that she made the statement. The spokesperson stated that the entire quote was fabricated and that Ocasio-Cortez has never discussed Chinese missiles or made any comments similar to the alleged quote.
Source of the meme: The expert's investigation found that the meme gained popularity when it was posted on the Facebook page of America's Last Line of Defense. This online publication is known for publishing satirical content that is often mistaken for valid news. The fact that the meme originated from a satirical source suggests that it is not an authentic quote.
Additional deceptive versions of the mem: The expert's investigation also found that there were other versions of the meme that were published by conservative individuals and pages. These versions included additional text that further perpetuated the deception. The existence of these deceptive versions of the meme raises doubts about the authenticity of the claim.
